column1: What did the mathematician do when he was constipated? he worked it out with a pencil
column3: worked can mean to solve a problem or to perform a task and also refers to a physical action or effort
column4: The team worked late into the night to finalize the project.
column5: He worked hard to build his muscles at the gym.

column1: A fine is a tax for doing wrong. a tax is a fine for doing well.
column3: fine can mean a monetary penalty for a violation and can also mean something being of high quality
column4: The driver received a fine for speeding in a school zone.
column5: The restaurant is known for its fine cuisine.

column1: What did the cyclops say to the sheep? ewe and eye make a great team.
column3: ewe refers to a female sheep and you is an informal way to address someone
column4: The farmer ensured that each ewe was healthy before the lambing season.
column5: You need to complete your homework before playing outside.
